oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Men; Soldiers; Heroes; Doors & doorways; Posing
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Fentress County (Tenn.); World War, 1914-1918 -- Tennessee -- History
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sergeant Alvin Cullum York pictured standing in front of an exterior door.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee. Dept. of Conservation
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sergeant Alvin Cullum York (1887-1964), Pall Mall, Tennessee, received the Congressional Medal of Honor and the Croix de Guerre for his heroic actions during World War I. During World War II, York served as Chairman of the Fentress County Draft Board, signed up with the Signal Corps and the Tennessee State Guard, and took part in bond tours, recruitment drives, and camp inspections.
